intro: Hymenoxys integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a head, typical of the daisy family. Hymenoxys integrifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
